# Listings {background-color='{{< brand color pink >}}' background-image='../../img/background-hex-shapes.svg' background-opacity='0.5'}

## Automatic content

We can automatically add all the pages in a folder to a sidebar:

::::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="6-10"}
website:
  sidebar:
    contents:
      - href: index.qmd
        text: Home
      - section: Research
        contents:
          - research/project1.qmd
          - research/project2.qmd
          - research/project3.qmd
````
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
```` {.yaml filename="_quarto.yml" code-line-numbers="6-7"}
website:
  sidebar:
    contents:
      - href: index.qmd
        text: Home
      - section: Research
        contents: research/*
````
:::
:::::

. . .

**What if we want fancier automatic pages?**

## Listing pages

::::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="40%"}

\ 

```` {.markdown filename="research.qmd" code-line-numbers="3-5"}
---
title: "Research"
listing:
  contents: "*.qmd"
  type: table
---
````

## Categories

![](img/listing-categories.png){fig-align="center" style="box-shadow: 5px 5px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3); border-radius: 5px;"}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%" .fragment}
**Enable categories in the listing settings**

```` {.yaml filename="listing-page.qmd"}
listing:
  categories: true
````
:::

::: {.column width="50%" .fragment}
**Specify categories in the document**

```` {.markdown filename="post.qmd" code-line-numbers="3-6"}
---
title: "Research"
categories:
  - statistics
  - r
  - tidyverse
---
````
:::

## Extra advanced bonus stuff

**Multiple listings**

Include lists of different document types on the same page ([example](https://www.andrewheiss.com/research/) + [code](https://github.com/andrewheiss/ath-quarto/blob/main/research/index.qmd))

. . .

**Custom listings**

Go beyond `default`, `table`, and `grid` and make your own template ([example](https://www.andrewheiss.com/research/) + [code](https://github.com/andrewheiss/ath-quarto/blob/main/html/research/listing.ejs))

. . .

**YAML lists**

Generate listings of items in a YAML file isntead of `.qmd` files ([example](https://www.andrewheiss.com/teaching/ + [code](https://github.com/andrewheiss/ath-quarto/blob/main/teaching/index.qmd) + [custom listing code](https://github.com/andrewheiss/ath-quarto/blob/main/html/teaching/listing.ejs)))
